intro: Sarcanthus duplicilobus, commonly known as the double-lobed sarcanthus, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its distinctive, lobed leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the rainy season. Its botanical features include a slender stem, opposite leaf arrangement, and a preference for well-drained, sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
